zone.line: stream
whose path, mid 2
Thou, upon whom in the steep sky's commotion
Loose clouds, like Earths decaying leaves,
are shed
Shook from the tangled boughs of Heaven
& Ocean
thunder is
Angels of rain & lightning — there are spread
On the blue surface of thine aery surge,
bright hair
Like the loose locks uplifted from the head
Of some fierce Maenad, even from the dim
verge
Of the horizon to the Zenith's height,
The hair of the approaching storm. Thou
Dirge
For Of the dying year, to which this closing
night . . .
Will be the dome of a vast sepulchre
Vaulted with all thy congregated might
whose solid atmosphere
Of vapours, from which lightning
Black floods & fire & hail will o hear
rain burst —
